abstract.text: The coordinate system’s y-axis is parallel to gravity, and its origin is the initial position of the device.
A value specifying how the session maps real-world device motion into a 3D scene coordinate system.
The object that manages the major tasks associated with every AR experience, such as motion tracking, camera passthrough, and image analysis.
Asks the delegate whether to attempt recovery of world-tracking state after an interruption.
A configuration that tracks the position of a device in relation to objects in the environment.
The state from a previous AR session to attempt to resume with this session configuration.
A flag that opts you in to a peer-to-peer multiuser AR experience.
A flag that determines whether ARKit tracks the user’s face in a world-tracking session.
Locate and interact with nearby devices using identifiers, distance, and direction.
A constant that indicates that the framework is unable to provide a world transform for a nearby object.
A Boolean value that combines the spatial awareness of ARKit with Nearby Interaction to improve the accuracy of a nearby object’s position.
An object that identifies a unique connection between two peer devices.
Provides the framework with an existing AR session to use for Camera Assistance.
Returns a world transform to integrate a nearby object in an AR experience.
Returns a world transform to integrate a nearby object in an AR experience.
The object that manages the major tasks associated with every AR experience, such as motion tracking, camera passthrough, and image analysis.
